text: So apparently Michiru Yamane also did the music for King's Valley 2.  That would explain the existence of this remix :)
author: Soma Cruz

text:
I love this! I think it's interesting Konami used it in a much later game of theirs, (not even the same french fries franchise) even if that's not entirely uncommon a thing to do :3
I think it is also interesting that they made it sound Israelite (Mediterranean?) at 0:30. Although, considering Israel bordered Egypt to the north since ancient times, it's not entirely out of place... 

I do wish they used the background/harmony part just before 0:30 from "The Next Pyramid" though, that was my favorite part of the entire song :{ 

All well, still sounds great! ^ ^
author: RATTLE ME SPOONS

author: Eirian Odalis

text: I'm glad this game remixed music from King's Valley 2. Otherwise I wouldn't have heard of that game, maybe even of the MSX!
author: Ambrose Burnout

text: For real? That's pretty interesting! I first heard about the MSX, Maze of Galious and King's Valley 2 from La-Mulana. I'm a sucker for retro and games (like La-Mulana 2005) that accurately portray the technical limitations of the era the game is supposed to be imitating. And I looove Castlevania, The Legend of Zelda, Metroid, and other old adventure game series. So, it was quite by design that I found (and instantly became deeply fond of) La-Mulana.
author: RATTLE ME SPOONS
